We are a beacon of democracy. We are a nation that embraces the view that voting is both a right and a duty.
 
As Martin Luther King Jr. said, ‚ÄúVoting is the foundation stone of political action.‚Äù And that is why we will never give up on the fight to vote.
Reverting to Jim Crow-like restrictions is not acceptable in 2022. Let‚Äôs not lose sight of the issue at hand: This is about ordinary Americans having to jump burdensome hurdles to cast their votes.

In Texas, hundreds of valid mail-in ballot applications have already been rejected because of state voting right restrictions that purposefully make it more difficult for Americans to exercise their basic rights.
Unfortunately, the Republican-backed efforts to silence low-income and communities of color across the country have already denied voters participation in our democracy.

Make no mistake ‚Äì to say we are disappointed with the outcome of the Senate‚Äôs vote on the Freedom to Vote: John Lewis Voting Rights Act is a grave understatement.
